types.name: Amount
types.description: Monetary amount with the corresponding currency code.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency code of the amount in ISO 4217 format.

types.name: Analytics_SalesAndTraffic_2024_04_24
types.description: A root type for Analytics Sales and Traffic queries version 2024_04_24.

fields.name: salesAndTrafficByAsin
fields.description: A query to retrieve sales and traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by ASIN.

args.name: aggregateBy
args.description: Determines how the sales and traffic data should be aggregated.

args.name: endDate
args.description:
The end date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. If a date
granularity is specified and the provided end date occurs mid-week or
mid-month, the preceding Saturday for WEEK date granularity or the last day
of the previous month for MONTH date granularity will be used instead.

args.name: marketplaceIds
args.description: The marketplace identifiers to retrieve sales and traffic data for.

args.name: startDate
args.description:
The start date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. The start date
must be no more than two years ago. If a date granularity is specified and
the provided start date occurs mid-week or mid-month, the following Sunday
for WEEK date granularity or the first day of the next month for MONTH date
granularity will be used instead.

fields.name: salesAndTrafficByDate
fields.description: A query to retrieve sales and traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by date.

args.name: aggregateBy
args.description: Determines how the sales and traffic data should be aggregated.

args.name: endDate
args.description:
The end date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. If the provided end
date occurs mid-week or mid-month, the preceding Saturday for WEEK date
granularity or the last day of the previous month for MONTH date granularity
will be used instead.

args.name: marketplaceIds
args.description: The marketplace identifiers to retrieve sales and traffic data for.

args.name: startDate
args.description:
The start date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. The start date
must be no more than two years ago. If the provided start date occurs
mid-week or mid-month, the following Sunday for WEEK date granularity or the
first day of the next month for MONTH date granularity will be used instead.

fields.name: salesAndTrafficTrends
fields.description:
This query retrieves sales and traffic trend data for a specified list of
ASINs within a date range. The data can be aggregated at different time
intervals to support various analytical needs.

args.name: asinAggregation
args.description: Specifies the ASIN level for data aggregation (currently only CHILD supported).

args.name: dateAggregation
args.description: Specifies the time period for data aggregation (DAY, WEEK, or MONTH).

args.name: endDate
args.description:
The end date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. If the provided end
date occurs mid-week or mid-month, the preceding Saturday for WEEK date
granularity or the last day of the previous month for MONTH date granularity
will be used instead.

args.name: filters
args.description:
Specifies the marketplace and child ASIN combinations for which to retrieve sales and traffic metrics.
Each filter represents a single marketplace and can include up to 30 child ASINs.
    
Note: If an ASIN does not exist or has no sales and traffic data for the
specified marketplace during the requested time period,
no data will be returned for that ASIN-marketplace combination. The response includes only ASINs with available data.

args.name: startDate
args.description:
The start date of the sales and traffic data to retrieve. The start date
must be no more than two years ago. If the provided start date occurs
mid-week or mid-month, the following Sunday for WEEK date granularity or the
first day of the next month for MONTH date granularity will be used instead.

types.name: AsinGranularity
types.description: The ASIN granularity used in aggregation.

enumValues.name: CHILD
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by child ASIN.

enumValues.name: PARENT
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by parent ASIN.

enumValues.name: SKU
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by sku.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: ByAsinSales
types.description: The sales data for the seller's account aggregated by ASIN.

fields.name: orderedProductSales
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales, calculated by multiplying the price of
products and the number of units sold for the selected time period.

fields.name: orderedProductSalesB2B
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales to Amazon Business customers, calculated
by multiplying the price of products and the number of units sold for the
selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: ordersShipped
fields.description: The number of orders shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: ordersShippedB2B
fields.description:
The number of orders shipped to Amazon Business customers for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: refundRate
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many orders were refunded,
calculated by dividing unitsRefunded by unitsOrdered for the selected time period.

fields.name: refundRateB2B
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many orders were refunded by
Amazon Business customers, calculated by dividing unitsRefundedB2B by
unitsOrderedB2B for the selected time period. Note: This field is only
populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: shippedProductSales
fields.description: The amount of ordered product sales shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: shippedProductSalesB2B
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales shipped to Amazon Business customers for
the selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller
is a B2B seller.

fields.name: totalOrderItems
fields.description: The number of items that were ordered for the selected time period.

fields.name: totalOrderItemsB2B
fields.description:
The number of items that were ordered by Amazon Business customers for the
selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsOrdered
fields.description: The number of units ordered.

fields.name: unitsOrderedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units ordered by Amazon Business customers. Note: This field is
only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsRefunded
fields.description: The number of units refunded for the selected time period.

fields.name: unitsRefundedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units refunded by Amazon Business customers for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsShipped
fields.description: The number of units shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: unitsShippedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units shipped to Amazon Business customers for the selected time
period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

types.name: ByAsinTraffic
types.description: The traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by ASIN.

fields.name: browserPageViews
fields.description: Browser page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com browser pages for the selected time period.

fields.name: browserPageViewsB2B
fields.description:
Browser B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer
visited your Amazon.com browser pages for the selected time period. Note: This
field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: browserPageViewsPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of browser page views that a particular SKU/ASIN receives
relative to the total number of browser page views for all products.

fields.name: browserPageViewsPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of browser views by Amazon Business customers that a particular
SKU/ASIN receives relative to the total number of mobile page views by Amazon
Business customers for all products. Note: This field is only populated when
the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: browserSessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of browser sessions that contain at least one page view for a
particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total number of browser sessions for all products.

fields.name: browserSessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of browser sessions that contain at least one page view by an
Amazon Business customer for a particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total
number of browser sessions by Amazon Business customers for all products.
Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: browserSessions
fields.description:
Browser sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser pages by a user. All
browser activity within a 24-hour period is considered a browser session. For
example, if a user visits your pages using a browser multiple times within a
24 hour period it is counted as a single browser session.

fields.name: browserSessionsB2B
fields.description:
Browser B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser pages by an Amazon
Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
browser session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your pages
using browser multiple times within a 24 hour period it is counted as a single
session. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: buyBoxPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of page views where the buy box (the add to shopping cart link)
appeared on the page for customers to add your product to their cart.

fields.name: buyBoxPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of page views by Amazon Business customers where the buy box
(the add to shopping cart link) appeared on the page for customers to add your
product to their cart. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViews
fields.description:
Mobile app page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com
mobile app pages for the selected time period.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViewsB2B
fields.description:
Mobile app B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer
visited your Amazon.com mobile app pages for the selected time period. Note:
This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViewsPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of mobile app page views that a particular SKU/ASIN receives
relative to the total number of mobile app page views for all products.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViewsPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of mobile page views by Amazon Business customers that a
particular SKU/ASIN receives relative to the total number of mobile page views
by Amazon Business customers for all products. Note: This field is only
populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppSessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of mobile app sessions that contain at least one page view for
a particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total number of mobile app sessions for all products.

fields.name: mobileAppSessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of mobile app sessions that contain at least one page view by
an Amazon Business customer for a particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total
number of mobile app sessions by Amazon Business customers for all products.
Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppSessions
fields.description:
Mobile app sessions are visits to your Amazon.com mobile app pages by a user.
All mobile app activity within a 24-hour period is considered a mobile app
session. For example, if a user visits your pages using a mobile app multiple
times within a 24 hour period it is counted as a single mobile app session.

fields.name: mobileAppSessionsB2B
fields.description:
Mobile app B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com mobile app pages by an
Amazon Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
mobile app session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your
pages using mobile app multiple times within a 24 hour period it is counted as
a single session. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: pageViews
fields.description:
Page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com browser or
mobile app pages for the selected time period. It is calculated as the sum of
browserPageViews and mobileAppPageViews.

fields.name: pageViewsB2B
fields.description:
B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer visited
your Amazon.com pages using browser or mobile app for the selected time
period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: pageViewsPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of browser and mobile app page views that a particular SKU/ASIN
receives relative to the total number of browser and mobile app page views for all products.

fields.name: pageViewsPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of page views by Amazon Business customers that a particular
SKU/ASIN receives relative to the total number of page views by Amazon
Business customers for all products. Note: This field is only populated when
the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: sessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of sessions that contain at least one page view for a
particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total number of sessions for all products.

fields.name: sessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of sessions that contain at least one page view by an Amazon
Business customer for a particular SKU/ASIN relative to the total number of
sessions by Amazon Business customers for all products. Note: This field is
only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: sessions
fields.description:
Sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser or mobile app pages by a user.
All browser and mobile app activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
session. It is calculated as the sum of browserSessions and mobileAppSessions.

fields.name: sessionsB2B
fields.description:
B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com pages using browser or mobile app
by an Amazon Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is
considered a session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your
pages multiple times using mobile app or browser within a 24 hour period it is
counted as a single session. Note: This field is only populated when the
seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitSessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many units were purchased
relative to the number of people who viewed the products, calculated by
dividing unitsOrdered by sessions.

fields.name: unitSessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many units were purchased by
Amazon Business customers relative to the number of Amazon Business customers
who viewed the products, calculated by dividing unitsOrderedB2B by sessions.
Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

types.name: ByDateSales
types.description: The sales data for the seller's account aggregated by date.

fields.name: averageSalesPerOrderItem
fields.description:
The average ordered product sales, calculated by dividing orderedProductSales
by totalOrderItems for the selected time period.

fields.name: averageSalesPerOrderItemB2B
fields.description:
The average ordered product sales to Amazon Business customers, calculated by
dividing orderedProductSalesB2B by totalOrderItemsB2B for the selected time
period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: averageSellingPrice
fields.description:
The average price of the units sold for the selected time period, calculated
by dividing the orderedProductSales by unitsOrdered for the selected time period.

fields.name: averageSellingPriceB2B
fields.description:
The average price of the units sold to Amazon Business customers, calculated
by dividing the orderedProductSalesB2B by unitsOrderedB2B for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: averageUnitsPerOrderItem
fields.description: The average number of units in each order item for the selected time period.

fields.name: averageUnitsPerOrderItemB2B
fields.description:
The average number of units in each order item ordered by Amazon Business
customers for the selected time period. Note: This field is only populated
when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: claimsAmount
fields.description: Monetary amount of filed A-to-z guarantee claims.

fields.name: claimsAmountB2B
fields.description:
Monetary amount of filed A-to-z guarantee claims for Amazon Business
customers. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: claimsGranted
fields.description: The number of A-to-z guarantee claims granted.

fields.name: claimsGrantedB2B
fields.description:
The number of A-to-z guarantee claims granted for Amazon Business customers.
Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: orderedProductSales
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales, calculated by multiplying the price of
products and the number of units sold for the selected time period.

fields.name: orderedProductSalesB2B
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales to Amazon Business customers, calculated
by multiplying the price of products and the number of units sold for the
selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: ordersShipped
fields.description: The number of orders shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: ordersShippedB2B
fields.description:
The number of orders shipped to Amazon Business customers for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: refundRate
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many orders were refunded by
the seller, calculated by dividing unitsRefunded by unitsOrdered for the
selected time period.

fields.name: refundRateB2B
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many orders were refunded by
Amazon Business customers, calculated by dividing unitsRefundedB2B by
unitsOrderedB2B for the selected time period. Note: This field is only
populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: shippedProductSales
fields.description: The amount of ordered product sales shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: shippedProductSalesB2B
fields.description:
The amount of ordered product sales shipped to Amazon Business customers for
the selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller
is a B2B seller.

fields.name: totalOrderItems
fields.description:
The number of items that were ordered for the selected time period. Example:
For an order containing 2 copies of book A and 3 copies of book B, the number
of orders is 1, the number of order items is 2 (book A and book B), and the
number of units is 5 (2 + 3).

fields.name: totalOrderItemsB2B
fields.description:
The number of items that were ordered by Amazon Business customers for the
selected time period. Example: For an order containing 2 copies of book A and
3 copies of book B, the number of orders is 1, the number of order items is 2
(book A and book B), and the number of units is 5 (2 + 3). Note: This field is
only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsOrdered
fields.description:
The number of units ordered for the selected time period. Example: For an
order containing 2 copies of book A and 3 copies of book B, the number of
orders is 1, the number of order items is 2 (book A and book B), and the
number of units is 5 (2 + 3).

fields.name: unitsOrderedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units ordered by Amazon Business customers for the selected time
period. Example: For an order containing 2 copies of book A and 3 copies of
book B, the number of orders is 1, the number of order items is 2 (book A and
book B), and the number of units is 5 (2 + 3). Note: This field is only
populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsRefunded
fields.description: The number of units refunded for the selected time period.

fields.name: unitsRefundedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units refunded by Amazon Business customers for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitsShipped
fields.description: The number of units shipped for the selected time period.

fields.name: unitsShippedB2B
fields.description:
The number of units shipped to Amazon Business customers for the selected time
period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

types.name: ByDateTraffic
types.description: The traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by date.

fields.name: averageOfferCount
fields.description:
The average number of offers listed for sale for the selected time period. It
is calculated from the total number of offers and the total number of days for
the selected time period.

fields.name: averageParentItems
fields.description: The average number of parent items listed for sale for the selected time period.

fields.name: browserPageViews
fields.description: Browser page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com browser pages for the selected time period.

fields.name: browserPageViewsB2B
fields.description:
Browser B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer
visited your Amazon.com browser pages for the selected time period. Note: This
field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: browserSessions
fields.description:
Browser sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser pages by a user. All
browser activity within a 24-hour period is considered a browser session. For
example, if a user visits your pages using a browser multiple times within a
24 hour period it is counted as a single browser session.

fields.name: browserSessionsB2B
fields.description:
Browser B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser pages by an Amazon
Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
browser session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your pages
using browser multiple times within a 24 hour period it is counted as a single
session. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: buyBoxPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage of page views where the buy box (the add to shopping cart link)
appeared on the page for customers to add your product to their cart.

fields.name: buyBoxPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage of page views by Amazon Business customers where the buy box
(the add to shopping cart link) appeared on the page for customers to add your
product to their cart. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: feedbackReceived
fields.description: The number of times customers left feedback for the selected time period.

fields.name: feedbackReceivedB2B
fields.description:
The number of times Amazon Business customers left feedback for the selected
time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViews
fields.description:
Mobile app page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com
mobile app pages for the selected time period.

fields.name: mobileAppPageViewsB2B
fields.description:
Mobile app B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer
visited your Amazon.com mobile app pages for the selected time period. Note:
This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: mobileAppSessions
fields.description:
Mobile app sessions are visits to your Amazon.com mobile app pages by a user.
All mobile app activity within a 24-hour period is considered a mobile app
session. For example, if a user visits your pages using a mobile app multiple
times within a 24 hour period it is counted as a single mobile app session.

fields.name: mobileAppSessionsB2B
fields.description:
Mobile app B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com mobile app pages by an
Amazon Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
mobile app session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your
pages using mobile app multiple times within a 24 hour period it is counted as
a single session. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: negativeFeedbackReceived
fields.description: The number of times customers left negative feedback for the selected time period.

fields.name: negativeFeedbackReceivedB2B
fields.description:
The number of times Amazon Business customers left negative feedback for the
selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: orderItemSessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many order items were
generated relative to the number of people who viewed the products.

fields.name: orderItemSessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many order items were
generated by Amazon Business customers relative to the number of Amazon
Business customers who viewed the products. Note: This field is only populated
when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: pageViews
fields.description:
Page views are the number of times a user visited your Amazon.com browser or
mobile app pages for the selected time period. It is calculated as the sum of
browserPageViews and mobileAppPageViews.

fields.name: pageViewsB2B
fields.description:
B2B page views are the number of times an Amazon Business customer visited
your Amazon.com pages using browser or mobile app for the selected time
period. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: receivedNegativeFeedbackRate
fields.description:
The negative feedback rate is the number of orders that have received negative
feedback divided by the number of orders for the selected time period.

fields.name: receivedNegativeFeedbackRateB2B
fields.description:
The negative feedback rate for Amazon Business customers is the number of
orders that have received negative feedback divided by the number of orders
for the selected time period. Note: This field is only populated when the
seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: sessions
fields.description:
Sessions are visits to your Amazon.com browser or mobile app pages by a user.
All browser and mobile app activity within a 24-hour period is considered a
session. It is calculated as the sum of browserSessions and mobileAppSessions.

fields.name: sessionsB2B
fields.description:
B2B sessions are visits to your Amazon.com pages using browser or mobile app
by an Amazon Business customer. All activity within a 24-hour period is
considered a session. For example, if an Amazon Business customer visits your
pages multiple times using mobile app or browser within a 24 hour period it is
counted as a single session. Note: This field is only populated when the
seller is a B2B seller.

fields.name: unitSessionPercentage
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many units were purchased
relative to the number of people who viewed the products.

fields.name: unitSessionPercentageB2B
fields.description:
The percentage conversion metric indicating how many units were purchased by
Amazon Business customers relative to number of Amazon Business customers who
viewed the products. Note: This field is only populated when the seller is a B2B seller.

types.name: Date
types.description: An RFC-3339 compliant Full Date Scalar. Example: "2023-11-15"

types.name: DateGranularity
types.description: The date granularity used in aggregation.

enumValues.name: DAY
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by day.

enumValues.name: MONTH
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by month.

enumValues.name: WEEK
enumValues.description: Sales and traffic data is aggregated by week.

types.name: Float
types.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Long
types.description: A Scalar for the primitive long type.

inputFields.name: asins
inputFields.description:
The child asins to fetch sales and traffic trend data for. Maximum size of the
list is 30. Note: ASINs with no sales or traffic data in the specified
marketplace during the date range will not be included in the results.

inputFields.name: marketplaceId
inputFields.description: The marketplace to retrieve sales and traffic data for.

types.name: Query
types.description: A root type for queries

fields.name: analytics_salesAndTraffic_2024_04_24
fields.description: Analytics Sales and Traffic queries version 2024_04_24.

types.name: SalesAndTrafficByAsin
types.description: The sales and traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by ASIN.

fields.name: childAsin
fields.description:
The Amazon Standard Identification Number of the child product. Child products
are unique, sellable products that are related in our catalog to a single,
non-sellable parent product. Note: This field is only present when ASIN
aggregation is CHILD or SKU.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: The end date of the period of the aggregated data.

fields.name: marketplaceId
fields.description: The marketplace identifier of the sales and traffic data.

fields.name: parentAsin
fields.description:
The Amazon Standard Identification Number of the parent product. A parent
product appears in our catalog as a non-buyable, generic identifier for a
product that has buyable variations (child products).

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales data for the parentAsin/childAsin/sku within the specified date range.

fields.name: sku
fields.description:
The Stock Keeping Unit of the product. The SKU is a seller specific product
identifier. Note: This field is only present when ASIN aggregation is SKU.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: The start date of the period of the aggregated data.

fields.name: traffic
fields.description: The traffic data for the parentAsin/childAsin/sku within the specified date range.

types.name: SalesAndTrafficByDate
types.description: The sales and traffic data for the seller's account aggregated by date.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: The end date of the sales and traffic data.

fields.name: marketplaceId
fields.description: The marketplace identifier of the sales and traffic data.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales data for the seller's account.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: The start date of the sales and traffic data.

fields.name: traffic
fields.description: The traffic data for the seller's account.

fields.name: asinAggregation
fields.description: Indicates the ASIN level at which the data is aggregated. Currently only CHILD is supported.

fields.name: childAsin
fields.description:
The Amazon Standard Identification Number of the child product. Child products
are unique, sellable products that are related in our catalog to a single,
non-sellable parent product. Note: This field is only present when ASIN
aggregation is CHILD or SKU.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: The end date of the period of the aggregated sales and traffic data.

fields.name: marketplaceId
fields.description: The marketplace identifier of the sales and traffic data.

fields.name: parentAsin
fields.description:
The Amazon Standard Identification Number of the parent product. A parent
product appears in our catalog as a non-buyable, generic identifier for a
product that has buyable variations (child products).

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The sales data for the parentAsin/childAsin/sku within the specified date range.

fields.name: sku
fields.description:
The Stock Keeping Unit of the product. The SKU is a seller specific product
identifier. Note: This field is only present when ASIN aggregation is SKU.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: The start date of the period of the aggregated sales and traffic data.

fields.name: traffic
fields.description: The traffic data for the parentAsin/childAsin/sku within the specified date range.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: resultRetention
directives.description:
This directive specifies the retention duration of a query containing a
particular field. When a query contains multiple fields with different
retentions, the shortest (minimum) retention is applied to the query. The
retention of a query's resulting documents always matches the retention of the query.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
